skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

	(all units in army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The altar prominently features a noble griffon bearing Ghal Maraz, Sigmar’s hammer and the emblem of Imperial unity and strength.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Warrior Priest implores Sigmar to imbue him with a modicum of divine strength, and now his hammer glows bright with power!
The Warrior Priest’s faith manifests in the form of a shield as hard as castle-forged steel.
A battle prayer that bathes the Warrior Priest in white, holy fire sears Sigmar’s foes but leaves the supplicant unharmed.
Practice makes the perfect warrior; when battle is instinctive as drawing breath, exalted status is achieved.
"But can all the horrors of the world kill these mere mortals?"

effects.description:
"Blessed Bullets" ammunition (magic, armour-piercing projectiles) for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)
Diplomatic relations: +40 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

Ability: "Frenzy" for Free Company Militia
	(all armies)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: A frenzied beating before battle focuses the mind on the brutal, bloody task at hand.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Wayfarer" for Flagellants, Empire Knights and Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: Burn away the darkness in the flames of conviction.
Blessings upon the just war, and the tools with which it is fought.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +15% for Warrior Priests and Witch Hunters
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who have sacrificed all to do the gods’ work enjoy more than a modicum of their protection.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Strength of the Penitent"
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
He who chooses the vile path of heresy can expect no mercy from the agents of Sigmar.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Warrior Priests
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

factionEffects.localised_description: Volkmar the Grim is the head of the Cult of Sigmar and the most powerful religious leader in the Empire. He is a pious and foreboding man, utterly devoted to the destruction of Chaos in all its forms.

effects.description: Volkmar is able to collect and seal the Books of Nagash, increasing his military prowess and preventing them from being exploited by others
